
1. Unzip the downloaded file.

```bash
$ unzip 62e3ec4c-1259-4d31-8620-75a83fd9bd98.zip 
Archive:  62e3ec4c-1259-4d31-8620-75a83fd9bd98.zip
  inflating: index.html
```

2. Reading the **index.html** revealed there is a **base64** encoding present inside the HTML code.

```html
$ cat index.html 
<!doctype html>
<html>
<head>
  <meta charset="utf-8">
  <title>Welcome</title>
</head>

<body>
  <h1>Welcome! ðŸ‘‹</h1>
  <form method="POST">
    <input type="hidden" name="64se64_encoding" value="">
  </form>
</body>
</html>
```

3. Copied the **base64** encoding to a different file and then decoded the encoding using **`base64 -d`** command and redirected the encoded format to a another different file.

```bash
$ echo '' > base64_encoding
$ base64 -d base64_encoding > base64_decoded
```

4. Reading the **base64_decoded** file reveals its a python script which will print the flag value so I add executable permissions to it and ran the program to get the flag.

```bash
$ cat base64_decoded
#!/usr/bin/env python3
asc=[68, 72, 123, 98, 101, 48, 52, 54, 98, 55, 53, 50, 50, 97, 97, 50, 101, 50, 56, 102, 50, 55, 54, 101, 48, 99, 57, 49, 48, 53, 50, 49, 102, 50, 51, 97, 48, 53, 56, 55, 48, 48, 53, 97, 56, 51, 55, 55, 51, 55, 48, 97, 49, 49, 101, 53, 101, 52, 100, 99, 49, 53, 102, 98, 50, 97, 98, 125]
arr=[0 for i in range(68)]
for i in range(0,68):
    arr[i]=chr(asc[i])
flag=''.join(arr)
print(flag) 

$ chmod +x base64_decoded
$ ./base64_decoded 
DH{redacted}
```
